intro: Echium scabrum, commonly known as the rough thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and tall spikes of blue or violet flowers. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its medicinal properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Echium scabrum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
